results.title: Waves in the ocean: Yrs 8-12
results.brief_description: Shows the beauty and order behind the movement of ocean waves. Includes: generation of waves in water, speed and length, how waves bend and change direction, beach building, reflection and wave motion.
results.description: Shows the beauty and order behind the movement of ocean waves. Includes: generation of waves in water, speed and length, how waves bend and change direction, beach building, reflection and wave motion.

results.title: Glass menagerie
results.creator_credit: Paul Newman, Burtt Harris and Columbia
results.brief_description: A shy girl seeks escape from reality of life in the St. Louis of the Great Depression and from her mother’s fantasies of constantly reliving the glory of her youth. The fragile balance of the family is changed when her brother arranges for a “gentleman caller” to pay a visit. Based on the play by Tennesse Williams. Stars Joanne Woodward, John Malkovich and Karen Allen.

results.title: Return to Dresden
results.creator_credit: Martin Duckworth, Jacques Vallee and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A record of a visit to Dresden, East Germany, by allied airmen who fire bombed the city during World War II and who are now members of the peace movement. Both the airmen and survivors of the bombing share their opinions against a backdop of archival footage of the raid. Challenges the viewer to wonder why human beings continue to inflict pain and suffering on one another.

results.title: Science and money
results.creator_credit: Mike Milne, Michael Coyle and BBC
results.brief_description: While this program is about British coinage, the information on coin alloys and the reasoning for notes versus coins remains relevant. Shows coins actually being tested from the basic alloy through the entire production process.

results.title: What should happen?: investigating community decision making
results.creator_credit: James Mann and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: An account of how a Year 9/10 class investigate a local issue, and in doing so, learn about the political process. Demonstrates the inquiry process in practice, emphasising collaborative learning, well planned field work and classroom reflection. Students are able to observe the tactics used by protagonists to influence the decision-making process.

results.title: What is a curriculum day?
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: A primary and postprimary teacher and parent/school councillor outline what is involved in a curriculum day. They discuss the benefits for both parents and teachers in evaluating school programs and ideas to facilitate the development of working relationships between both parties.

results.title: Visions of perfection
results.creator_credit: Diane Charleson, Prahran School Support Centre and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: The Victoria College of the Arts provides a venue for talented children in the performing arts of music and dance to combine these with their academic studies in a high school setting. A student violinist, percussionist, ballet dancer and pianist talk about the courses available and demonstrate some of the activities in the school.

results.title: Two languages are better than one
results.creator_credit: Jan Denton, John Moore and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A bilingual program offers instruction in two languages. Substantial community support is required to successfully establish a bilingual program. This may be forcoming if people are provided with sufficient information upon which to base fruitful discussion. This video provides a starting point for such discussion.

results.title: The Right ingredients
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke, George Cass, Arts Victoria, Australian Bicentennial Authority, Australian Film Commission, Department of Sport and Recreation and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A look behind the scenes of the Australian Ballet School and the preparations of blocking the dancers in the classroom to the final performance. We see students rehearsing and dancing to the modern ballet “Signatures” and the classical ballet “The Nutcracker”. Contains commentary from Dame Margaret Scott and Kevin Coe.

results.title: Movietone memories
results.creator_credit: Alec Morgan, Chris Oliver, Film World and Tru-Vu Pictures
results.brief_description: A unique time capsule of our country’s past as captured by the Movietone news crews from the early thirties though to the mid fifties. The headlines, our sporting achivements, the tragedies, and our nation’s often off-beat sense of humour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alec Morgan, Chris Oliver, Film World and Tru-Vu Pictures
results.description: A unique time capsule of our country’s past as captured by the Movietone news crews from the early thirties though to the mid fifties. The headlines, our sporting achivements, the tragedies, and our nation’s often off-beat sense of humour.
